japanese: 最初の頃は結構気を張ってたけどそのうちやっつけ仕事になったから、そんな質のいいもんじゃなかったと思うわ。
english: Even though I put my all into this to begin with it ended up being menial work, so I think it didn't turn out great.

japanese: 私は今歌う。
english: I sing now.

japanese: 時間を節約するのには何をすべきだろう？
english: What should I do in order to save time?

japanese: 日曜に行くよ。
english: I'll go on Sunday.

japanese: 今日は木曜日です。
english: Today is Thursday.

japanese: 今日は金曜日だよ。
english: Today is Friday.

japanese: マイケルが本を読んでる。
english: Michael is reading a book.

japanese: 彼は私が彼女を愛してると思ってる。
english: He thinks I love her.

japanese: 私を助けに来て。
english: Come to help me.

japanese: 助けに来てください。
english: Come to help me.

japanese: 男の子は牛乳を飲んでいます。
english: The boy is drinking milk.

japanese: 幾つか質問してもいいですか？
english: May I ask you a few questions?

japanese: お姉ちゃんの髪はサラサラでいいな。なんで私の髪はこんなにバサバサなんだろう。
english: My sister's hair is nice and silky. Why does mine have to be so dry?

japanese: 普段あまり食べないのに、お茶漬けをさらさらと食べているコマーシャルを見ると、無性に食べたくなってしまう。
english: I don't usually eat it, but because I saw the commercial where the person was slurping down ochazuke, it made me really crave it.

japanese: 彼はわたしの過ちをさらりと水に流してくれた。
english: He didn't mind any of my mistakes.

japanese: 彼女はニコッとしながらきついことをさらっと言う。
english: Her words are blunt and harsh, and yet said with a sweet smile.

japanese: この下着は、さらっとした通気性のよい生地を使用しています。
english: These underwear are made from a smooth, breathable fabric.

japanese: いきなりザアッと雨が激しく降ったかと思ったら、今はカラッと晴れている。
english: First it starts bucketing down, then all of a sudden the weather clears up.

japanese: 開演前の会場はとてもざわざわしていた。
english: There was a lot of clamour in the venue before the performance began.

japanese: 弟は今オーストラリアにいます。
english: My brother is in Australia now.

japanese: 家は丘の上にある。
english: My house is on a hill.

japanese: そのひったくりは、その体を押さえつけている私からなんとか逃れようと、じたばたともがいていた。
english: The purse snatcher was frantically struggling to get away from me while I had him pinned down.

japanese: いいえ、体調は良くないんです。
english: No, I'm not well.

japanese: お前のこと、うらやましくないし。
english: I don't envy you.

japanese: 甥っ子と姪っ子が遊びに来たのはいいが、朝から晩までどたばたと家中を走り回り、うるさくて仕方がない。
english: It's great that my nephew and niece came over to play, but they're so annoying making such a racket running all over the house all day that I can't stand it.

japanese: 小さな子供のいる家庭は、毎日がどたばたして大変だと思う。
english: I expect every day is chaos for families with small children.

japanese: そのお金はもう俺のものじゃないから、返さないで欲しい。
english: This money isn't mine anymore. I don't want you to return it.

japanese: つわりがひどくて、何も食べられない。
english: I have horrible morning sickness. I can't eat anything.

japanese: 小さな田舎町で起きた失踪事件と殺人事件で、町中がてんやわんやだ。
english: The small rural village was in disarray after the disappearance and murder incidents.

japanese: お前って本当にうじうじして煮え切らない奴だなあ。俺に言いたいことがあるなら今ここではっきり言えよ。
english: You're one stubbornly indecisive guy, you know that? If you have something to say to me, say it now, and clearly.

japanese: 庭にあった鉢植えをどけたら、小さな虫がうじゃうじゃといて、思わず悲鳴をあげてしまった。
english: When I lifted a potted plant in my garden, there were swarms of little insects crawling underneath, and I instinctively let out a shriek.

japanese: 友達のケイちゃんは、私が困っているときにはいつもすっと現れて私を助けてくれた。
english: Whenever I'm in trouble, my friend Kei always appears out of nowhere to help.

japanese: 昨日の大雪のせいで地面はツルツル、私は外に出た途端にすってんころりと尻もちをついた。
english: Because of yesterday's heavy snow, the ground is very slippery. As soon as I stepped outside, I slipped and fell on my bottom.

japanese: 美しい富士山の景色が見えるかと期待していたが、あいにくと雲がすっぽりと山を覆っていた。
english: I was looking forward to seeing a scenic view of Mt. Fuji, but unfortunately it was completely hidden behind clouds.

japanese: お酒を飲んだ後の記憶がすっぽりと抜けているんだよ。どうして俺の部屋に知らないおっさんが寝てるんだ？
english: I have absolutely no clue what happened after I got drunk. Why is there some old dude sleeping in my room?

japanese: 台風の影響でダイヤが乱れ、どの電車もすし詰め状態だった。
english: Due to the typhoon, the train schedule was disturbed and all the trains were jam-packed.

japanese: この女の子、まだ小学生なのに利き酒師の資格を持っているんだってさ。お酒が飲めなくても資格が取れるなんて知らなかったよ。
english: This girl is still in elementary school, yet she has a wine-tasting master license. I didn't know one could get qualified without even drinking alcohol.

japanese: 度胸が足りないぞ。
english: You don't have the guts.

japanese: あなたはリーダーとしての資格がない。
english: You don't have what it takes to be a leader.

japanese: あすこの女の人見て！
english: Check out that woman!

japanese: 勇気を出してメアリーを映画に誘ったのに、すっぽかされてしまった。
english: Even though I plucked up courage to invite Mary to a film, she stood me up.

japanese: サーブを打ったと同時にラケットがすっぽ抜け、コートに叩きつけられたラケットが折れてしまった。
english: The racket slipped from my hands and broke itself on the court when I made the serve.

japanese: 野球とかサッカーとかの観戦にはあまり興味がないんだけど、珍プレーや好プレーを見るのはおもしろいね。
english: I don't have much interest in sports games like soccer or baseball, but I do like seeing weird or outstanding plays in them.

japanese: 公園で見かけたリスを写真に収めようとしたが、すばしっこくて一枚もいいのが撮れなかった。
english: I was going to take a picture of a squirrel I found in the park, but it was too nimble, and all my shots were no good.

japanese: バイクはいいなあ、渋滞の中でもすいすいと通り抜けられて。
english: Motorbikes are nice. You can move smoothly even through a traffic jam.

japanese: ペンギンって、陸上ではヨチヨチのイメージだけど、水の中ではスイスイとカッコよく泳ぐんだね。
english: Penguins look strange when they waddle on land, but the way they swim so smoothly through the water is pretty cool.

japanese: お化けなんてこわくないと言っていた貴士だが、誰もいないはずの２階で物音がした途端、すたこらさっさと逃げ出したのだった。
english: Takashi said he wasn't afraid of ghosts, but when he heard some sounds from the supposedly empty second floor, he quickly scrambled away.

japanese: 彼は私たちに地図だけ渡し、先にすたすたと行ってしまった。残された私たちは地図だけを頼りに行かなければならなかった。
english: The only thing he did before he briskly went on ahead was give us a map. The remainder of us could only rely on the map to figure out where to go.

japanese: いくら我が家がテレビで紹介されたからと言って、勝手にずかずかと庭に入り込んで写真を取るのはやめてほしい。
english: Even though our house was on TV, I'd prefer it if you wouldn't just barge in our garden and take pictures.

japanese: エミコは人の気持ちを考えずにいつもずけずけとものを言うので、みんなから嫌われている。
english: Emiko never thinks about others' feelings and always says things too bluntly, so everyone hates her.

japanese: 私の息子は動物の本が好きです。
english: My son likes books about animals.

japanese: 鼻水をズルズルとすすってないで、ちゃんと鼻をかみなさい。
english: Quit sniffling and blow your nose.

japanese: 先生によれば、私はよい生徒だそうです。
english: According to my teacher, I'm a good pupil.

japanese: 俺の考えじゃ、あいつはただのバカだ。
english: In my opinion, he is just a fool.

japanese: 別れた男のことをいつまでもずるずると引きずるのはやめなよ。新しい恋を見つけなきゃ。
english: Stop obsessing over the man you broke up with. You should find a new partner.

japanese: トムは足をゴシゴシ洗った。
english: Tom scrubbed his feet.

japanese: ついていけません。もっとゆっくりでお願いします。
english: I can't keep up with you. Could you dictate a bit slower?

japanese: お姫様ごっこをしていた娘は私のスカートをドレスのように身にまとい、ずるずる引きずりながらこっちに向かって歩いてきた。
english: My daughter, who was pretending to be a princess, wore my skirt as a dress, dragging it on the ground as she walked towards me.

japanese: 暗い場所が怖くて。
english: I'm afraid of the dark.

japanese: 暗い場所が苦手なの。
english: I'm afraid of the dark.

japanese: トムはわなを仕掛けた。
english: Tom set a trap.

japanese: トムは私を罠にはめた。
english: Tom set me up.

japanese: トムに週末を台無しにされた。
english: Tom ruined my weekend.

japanese: トムのせいでさんざんな週末だった。
english: Tom ruined my weekend.

japanese: この中に欲しいものはない。
english: I don't want either of them.

japanese: パパ、メアリーが叩いた！
english: Dad, Mary hit me!

japanese: 最後の調整を完了するために五分ください。
english: Give me five minutes to finish the last adjustments.

japanese: 君は本当にせっかちだなあ。「急いては事をし損じる」という言葉を知らんのか。
english: You're being too impatient. Haven't you heard the phrase "Haste makes waste"?

japanese: メキシコにはたくさんのスラムがある。
english: There are many slums in Mexico.

japanese: 砂糖と間違えてコーヒーに塩を入れちゃった？！あんたってどれだけおっちょこちょいなの？
english: You mistook the salt for sugar and put it in your coffee?! How careless can you get?

japanese: 仕事にも行かずに、いつまでこんなぐうたらな生活を続ける気？
english: Not even going to work, do you want to keep living like this?

japanese: 大の男がいちいちゴキブリやクモを見て悲鳴を上げないの！
english: Grown men don't scream when they see cockroaches or spiders.

japanese: どんな話だったか、大まかに説明してみてよ。
english: Try to explain roughly what the talk was about.

japanese: やっぱり都会より田舎の方が大らかな人が多いのかな。
english: I guess there are more easygoing people in the countryside compared to the city after all.

japanese: トムさんは一生独身のまま人生を暮した。
english: Tom remained single his whole life.

japanese: 読め！
english: Read!

japanese: どうしたの、朝からそわそわしてるけど。なんか、心ここにあらずって感じだよ。
english: What's the matter? You've been fidgety since this morning. You seem out of it.

japanese: もしかして鍋を火にかけっぱなしではないかと、家に戻るまで気が気じゃなかった。
english: I was unable to ease my worries that I might have left something in the pan until I finally arrived home.

japanese: いいえ？
english: No?

japanese: 違う？
english: No?

japanese: ほんとじゃないの？
english: Isn't it true?

japanese: マジだよね？
english: Isn't it true?

japanese: 本当なんじゃないですか？
english: Isn't it true?

japanese: 図書館に手袋を置き忘れてきた。
english: I left my gloves in the library.

japanese: スラッピー・ジョーって、人の名前じゃなかったの？
english: Isn't "Sloppy Joe" someone's name?

japanese: どうするかは、お前次第だよ。
english: It's up to you to decide what to do.

japanese: 我らに今日も日々の糧をお与えください。我らの負い目をお許しください。我々も、我らに負い目のある者たちを許します。
english: Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

japanese: 冷蔵庫に卵をしまって。
english: Put the eggs in the fridge.

japanese: こんなに早く起きて、珍しいことだ。
english: You rarely ever wake up this early.

japanese: たまには一歩下がって考えるべきだ。
english: Once in a while, we should take a step back and think.

japanese: 僕はジーンと話したい。
english: I'd like to talk to Jean.

japanese: 登場人物の躍動的な関わり合いこそがこの小説をかくも偉大なものとしている。
english: It's the dynamic interaction between the characters that makes this novel so great.

japanese: コーヒー、砂糖が入りすぎだよ。
english: There's too much sugar in the coffee.

japanese: 彼は気立てが良さそうだ。
english: He looks good-natured.

japanese: お前は俺の、本当の友だちだ！
english: You are my true friend!

japanese: それはまったくの道理に思える。
english: That seems perfectly reasonable.

japanese: 今週はよく働いた。
english: I worked a lot this week.

japanese: 彼女が道に迷ったんじゃないかと心配です。
english: I'm worried that she may have gotten lost.

japanese: その教師は英会話を教えている。
english: That teacher is teaching English conversation.

japanese: トムがこういうことやるには、年齢が高すぎるかもしれないな。
english: Perhaps Tom is too old to do this kind of thing.

japanese: トムは財布にドナーカードを入れている。
english: Tom has an organ donor card in his wallet.

japanese: 明日は土曜日ですか。
english: Is tomorrow Saturday?

japanese: トムはフェンスのペンキ塗りの最中、シャツにペンキをつけてしまった。
english: Tom got paint on his shirt while he was painting the fence.

japanese: トムはいつも車のトランクにブースターケーブルを積んでいる。
english: Tom always keeps a set of jumper cables in the trunk of his car.

japanese: 明日は2011年2月5日土曜日です。
english: Tomorrow is Saturday, February 5th, 2011.

japanese: 彼女は日本人女性です。
english: She is Japanese.

japanese: 彼女は日本人です。
english: She is Japanese.

japanese: トムは身動きが取れない状態だ。
english: Tom is stuck right now.

japanese: あの車に追い抜かれた。
english: I was overtaken by that car.

japanese: ああ、君にして欲しい。
english: Yeah, I want you to do it.

japanese: リンゴは何個あるの？
english: How many apples are there?

japanese: ああ、君にしてもらいたい。
english: Yeah, I want you to do it.

japanese: この扉は内側から施錠されている。
english: This door is locked from the inside.

japanese: このドアは内側から鍵が掛かっている。
english: This door is locked from the inside.

japanese: 君のこと心配したよ。
english: I was worried about you.

japanese: 俺はお前とは違うんだ。
english: I am not like you.

japanese: 私の父はこの結果について満足な気持ちです。
english: My father feels satisfied about this result.

japanese: トムさんのお家はトムさんの子供のころ、よく引っ越しました。
english: Tom's family moved around quite a bit when he was a kid.

japanese: トムが幼い頃に、トムの家族はよく引っ越しをした。
english: Tom's family moved around quite a bit when he was a kid.

japanese: トムのお家は、トムが子供の頃によく引っ越しをしていた。
english: Tom's family moved around quite a bit when he was a kid.

japanese: トムはレタスを千切りにした。
english: Tom shredded the lettuce.

japanese: トムとしたことが何やってるんだよ。
english: Tom should've known better.

japanese: トムはメアリーを撃った。
english: Tom shot Mary.

japanese: トムはかなり動揺しているようだ。
english: Tom seems quite upset.

japanese: トムは結構動揺してるみたい。
english: Tom seems quite upset.

japanese: トムはメアリーを叱った。
english: Tom scolded Mary.

japanese: トムは医者に診てもらった。
english: Tom saw a doctor.

japanese: トムは病院に行った。
english: Tom saw a doctor.

japanese: トムはメアリーに別れを告げた。
english: Tom said goodbye to Mary.

japanese: トムはロケットコースターに乗った。
english: Tom rode the roller coaster.

japanese: トムさんはチャイムを押しました。
english: Tom rang the doorbell.

japanese: トムは駆け足で階段を上っていった。
english: Tom ran up the stairs.

japanese: トムは必死に逃げた。
english: Tom ran for his life.

japanese: トムは卵に塩をかけた。
english: Tom put some salt on his eggs.

japanese: トムね、テストに合格したんだよ。
english: Tom passed the test.

japanese: トムはテストに受かったよ。
english: Tom passed the test.

japanese: トムは３年前に亡くなりました。
english: Tom passed away three years ago.

japanese: トムは３年前に他界しました。
english: Tom passed away three years ago.

japanese: トムは寝坊した。
english: Tom overslept.

japanese: トムは禁煙すべきだ。
english: Tom ought to stop smoking.

japanese: トムはタバコを止めるべきだよ。
english: Tom ought to stop smoking.

japanese: トムが窓を開けたよ。
english: Tom opened a window.

japanese: トムはよく自転車で学校に行ってるよ。
english: Tom often goes to school by bicycle.

japanese: トムはちょくちょく自転車で通学してるよ。
english: Tom often goes to school by bicycle.

japanese: トムはメアリーを傷つけた。
english: Tom offended Mary.

japanese: トムは今ボストンに住んでいます。
english: Tom now lives in Boston.

japanese: トムはいつでも冷静さを失わない。
english: Tom never loses his cool.

japanese: トムはジャンクフードを一切食べない。
english: Tom never eats junk food.

japanese: トムはボストンへの切符2枚が必要です。
english: Tom needs two tickets to Boston.

japanese: トムが君に話があるって。
english: Tom needs to talk to you.

japanese: トムは髪を切らなきゃいけない。
english: Tom needs a haircut.

japanese: トムが正しいのかもしれない。
english: Tom may be right.

japanese: トムは夕食にシチューを作った。
english: Tom made stew for dinner.

japanese: トムね、激やせしてた。
english: Tom lost a lot of weight.

japanese: トムはドアに鍵をかけた。
english: Tom locked the door.

japanese: トムはストーブに火をつけました。
english: Tom lit the stove.

japanese: トムは自分の葉巻に火をつけた。
english: Tom lit his cigar.

japanese: トムは旅行が好きです。
english: Tom likes traveling.

japanese: トムはメアリーの新しい髪型が気に入った。
english: Tom liked Mary's new hairstyle.

japanese: トムはちょっと分かってないんだよ。
english: Tom just doesn't understand.

japanese: トムは毎朝、ジョギングをします。
english: Tom jogs every morning.

japanese: トムは私の理想の男性だ。
english: Tom is the man of my dreams.

japanese: トムはお客さんです。
english: Tom is our guest.

japanese: メアリーは理想の女性です。
english: Mary is the woman of my dreams.

japanese: メアリーは、私が夢にまで見た女性です。
english: Mary is the woman of my dreams.

japanese: どうやってそんな考えを思いついたの？
english: How did you come up with that idea?

japanese: すぐ家に戻ってくる？
english: Will you come back home soon?

japanese: 子供は本当に汀線で遊ぶのは大好きだ。
english: Children really like playing on the beach.

japanese: 君もそうよ、息子！
english: You are too, son!

japanese: 学生たちが戻って来ました。
english: The students have returned.

japanese: 了解！
english: Roger!

japanese: ラジャー！
english: Roger!

japanese: これはもしかして私の秘書の研究かもしれません。
english: This may be research my secretary did.

japanese: スーパーに行ってきました。
english: I went to the supermarket.

japanese: スーパーに行ってきたよ。
english: I went to the supermarket.

japanese: ジェーンさんは明日の朝なにをしますか。
english: What is Jane going to do tomorrow morning?

japanese: 前もって言ってくれれば空けたのに。明日は実家に帰る予定だ。
english: If you'd told me about it earlier, I could've been free. However, tomorrow I have plans to go back home.

japanese: 葬式を干渉するのはひどく失敬なまねだ。
english: Interfering with a funeral is a great show of disrespect.

japanese: ５万ほど貸してくれよと言われたが、５万も貸せばおまんま食えぬ。
english: He asked me to lend him fifty grand, but, if I do that, I won't have enough money to eat.

japanese: 息をこらえて！毒ガスだ。
english: Don't breathe! It's poisonous gas.

japanese: 小学校低学年の頃、僕は父に俳句を教えられ、俳人に憧れた。七夕の願い事も「はい人になれますように」と書いた。あれから３０年、願いはかなった。今や僕は紛れもない廃人だ。
english: When I was in my first years of grade school, my father taught me a haiku and I longed to be a poet. On my Tanabata wish, I also wrote "Please make me a poet". Thirty years have passed and my wish has been granted. I am without doubt an invalid.

japanese: このケーキを作るためには膨らし粉と無塩バターが必要だ。
english: In order to make this cake you need baking powder and unsalted butter.

japanese: 彼女には率直に伝えました。
english: I told her straight.

japanese: 車の数が増えている。
english: The number of cars is increasing.

japanese: アリは自分の体重の５０倍以上の物を持ち上げることができる。
english: An ant can lift more than 50 times its weight.

japanese: ポーランドでは今日が投票日です。

english: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.

english: When I went into his room, he showed me the numerous trophies he had won during the twenty years he had played golf.

japanese: 「マキちゃんて双子らしいよ」健が言った。「知らんがな」俺は興味がないので冷たく返す。マキちゃんというのは学生ラウンジで俺たちのサークルの隣に陣取っているウクレレサークルの女の子だ。健の目にはずいぶん可憐に映っているようだが、俺に言わせればクラスで６番目に可愛いくらいの普通の娘だ。
english: "Looks like Maki's a twin!" Ken said. "Really now," I replied, totally uninterested. Maki was a member of a ukulele club that ran beside our club in the school lounge. She looked lovely in Ken's eyes, but to me she was just the sixth cutest girl in class - average, in my opinion.

japanese: 彼女は何を見ているのか。

japanese: 「お前が折った木の種類わかるか？」「いや知らない」刑事に問われ俺は答えた。刑事は開いたドアの方を見ながら「おい、こいつの折った木の種類わかるか？」と声を上げた。「えっと、槙らしいです」と若い女性の声。刑事は居住まいを正すと「お前が折った木の種類わかるか？」ともう一度聞いた。
english: "Do you know what kind of tree you just broke?" "No, I don't," I answered the detective. While looking through the open door, the detective shouted, "Hey, do you know what kind of tree he just broke?" "Um, looks like it's a yew plum pine," said the voice of a young woman. After straightening himself in his seat, the detective asked me one more time: "Do you know what kind of tree you just broke?"

japanese: いつも行く店はカルビーのポテチが９８円。うす塩が俺のお気に入りだ。このうす塩味、実は時期によって原材料が変わる。今日のは化学調味料なしの自然塩。俺的に当たりだ。
english: The store that I always go to has Calbee potato chips on sale for 98 yen a bag. My favorite flavor is lightly salted. As a matter of fact, the ingredients for this particular flavor changes from time to time. Today's chips are chemical-free, made with natural salt. Fitting for someone like me.

english: I've kept a blog before. I didn't really have a set theme; I just blogged about whatever happened that day.

english: I sent an email to an old friend of mine. We haven't kept in touch for awhile, being that the last time we met was over two years ago and haven't contacted each other since. There's no reply from her yet. I'm starting to get anxious.

english: That dress looks good on you, but it makes you look pregnant. Oh, no, not the figure; I meant the design.

english: Quickly, evacuate to the hill.

english: Please hurry up and evacuate to a high place.

english: Such a thing as disliking fish because they have bones - that just can't be a reason for disliking them.

english: How do you make a triangle-shaped onigiri? No matter how many times I try I can only make round onigiri.

english: Could you please not talk to me about cakes? I'm in the middle of a diet, and you're making me want one, you know!

english: I'll give these puppies to anyone who likes dogs.

japanese: あっちが終わり次第、手伝うよ。
english: As soon as I've finished doing that, I'll help you.

japanese: 何が何でも約束は守るよ。
english: No matter what happens, I'll keep my promise.

japanese: 正当な理由がない限り、お前と離婚するつもりはないからな。
english: I won't divorce you unless you give me a good reason.

japanese: 今日のランチは俺が出すよ。
english: I'll pay for your lunch today.

japanese: 今日のランチ、僕がおごるよ。
english: I'll pay for your lunch today.

japanese: この事件のことは一生忘れないよ。
english: I'll remember this incident forever.
